1.text: Behold, what manner of love the Father has bestowed on us, that we should be called the sons of God: therefore the world knows us not, because it knew him not.

2.text: Beloved, now are we the sons of God, and it does not yet appear what we shall be: but we know that, when he shall appear, we shall be like him; for we shall see him as he is.

3.text: And every man that has this hope in him purifies himself, even as he is pure.

4.text: Whoever commits sin transgresses also the law: for sin is the transgression of the law.

5.text: And you know that he was manifested to take away our sins; and in him is no sin.

6.text: Whoever stays in him sins not: whoever sins has not seen him, neither known him.

7.text: Little children, let no man deceive you: he that does righteousness is righteous, even as he is righteous.

8.text: He that commits sin is of the devil; for the devil sins from the beginning. For this purpose the Son of God was manifested, that he might destroy the works of the devil.

9.text: Whoever is born of God does not commit sin; for his seed remains in him: and he cannot sin, because he is born of God.

10.text: In this the children of God are manifest, and the children of the devil: whoever does not righteousness is not of God, neither he that loves not his brother.

11.text: For this is the message that you heard from the beginning, that we should love one another.

12.text: Not as Cain, who was of that wicked one, and slew his brother. And why slew he him? Because his own works were evil, and his brother’s righteous.

13.text: Marvel not, my brothers, if the world hate you.

14.text: We know that we have passed from death to life, because we love the brothers. He that loves not his brother stays in death.

15.text: Whoever hates his brother is a murderer: and you know that no murderer has eternal life abiding in him.

16.text: Hereby perceive we the love of God, because he laid down his life for us: and we ought to lay down our lives for the brothers.

17.text: But whoever has this world’s good, and sees his brother have need, and shuts up his bowels of compassion from him, how dwells the love of God in him?

18.text: My little children, let us not love in word, neither in tongue; but in deed and in truth.

19.text: And hereby we know that we are of the truth, and shall assure our hearts before him.

20.text: For if our heart condemn us, God is greater than our heart, and knows all things.

21.text: Beloved, if our heart condemn us not, then have we confidence toward God.

22.text: And whatever we ask, we receive of him, because we keep his commandments, and do those things that are pleasing in his sight.

23.text: And this is his commandment, That we should believe on the name of his Son Jesus Christ, and love one another, as he gave us commandment.

24.text: And he that keeps his commandments dwells in him, and he in him. And hereby we know that he stays in us, by the Spirit which he has given us.
